description:
Trichoderma asperellum CBS 433.97 is a fungal species belonging to the genus Trichoderma. It is a filamentous, asexual, and heterotrophic microorganism that is commonly found in soil and other organic substrates.

Trichoderma asperellum is a fast-growing, green-colored fungus that produces numerous spores, known as conidia, which are responsible for its rapid dispersal and colonization of various environments. The fungus has a complex life cycle, involving the production of both vegetative and reproductive structures.

One of the notable characteristics of T. asperellum CBS 433.97 is its ability to produce a range of secondary metabolites, including enzymes and antibiotics, which contribute to its antagonistic interactions with other microorganisms. This property has made Trichoderma species, including T. asperellum, valuable in various agricultural and biotechnological applications, such as biological control of plant pathogens, soil bioremediation, and the production of industrially relevant enzymes.

The strain CBS 433.97 is a specific isolate of T. asperellum that has been studied and characterized by the Centraalbureau voor Schimmelcultures (CBS) culture collection, a renowned institution for the identification and preservation of fungal strains.
